info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster, northwestern Columbia, south central Albany and eastern Greene Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Saugerties, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hudson, Catskill, Saugerties, Coxsackie, Valatie, Athens, Kinderhook, Lorenz Park, Saugerties South, North-South Lake Campground, Cairo, Veteran, Stockport, Stuyvesant, Germantown, Centerville, Quarryville, Burden Dock, Manorville and Katsbaan. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 20 and 21B. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.
